meanings.definition: Not typical or usual; above or below the average.
meanings.sent1: She had an unaverage talent for painting.
meanings.sent2: The weather today was unaverage for this time of year.
meanings.sent3: His unaverage sense of humor always made us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unaverage size of the cake made it stand out at the party.
meanings.sent5: The unaverage color of her hair caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To make something not average; to deviate from the norm.
meanings.sent1: He tried to unaverage the results of the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The artist wanted to unaverage his style to be more unique.
meanings.sent3: She decided to unaverage her routine by trying a new hobby.
meanings.sent4: The team's strategy was to unaverage their gameplay for a surprise attack.
meanings.sent5: The chef aimed to unaverage the traditional recipe with a modern twist.
